paper.title: On-line windows scheduling of temporary items

author.org: Department of Computer Science, University of Hong Kong, Hong Kong
Department of Computer Science, University of Liverpool, UK;

paper.venue: International Symposium on Algorithms and Computation
paper.abstract: In this paper we study on-line windows scheduling (WS) of temporary items In a broadcasting system, there are some broadcast channels, each can broadcast one item in one time unit Upon the arrival of an item with a window w, where w is a positive integer, the item has to be scheduled on a channel such that it will be broadcasted in the channel at least once every w time units until its departure With the on-line input of these temporary items, the problem is to minimize the maximum number of channels used over all time We give a 5-competitive on-line algorithm and show that there is a lower bound of 2â€“e for any e u003e 0 on the competitive ratio of any on-line algorithm.
